column4: hi folks! a question:  i have openssh runing nice on my home desktop. What i want to do is to run openssh on startup thru a script. I have been reading some stuf about rc.d and others. I would be glad if someone could explain me what are the rc files, and how can i do it with openssh! (as u can see i am new to linux)
if you installed the openssh service from the package manager it should allredy be auto-running at boot time
check google for 'sysv init' tutorials :) they are fancy scripts. but ubuntu is slowly changeing over to the UPSTART init systemm
so a lot of things in the sysv guides/tutorials dont always apply to ubuntu
